details.solvent: 2 N H2SO4 solution prepared with 18O-enriched water

challenge.description: Incomplete oxidation of CaFeO2.5 to CaFeO3 due to limited concentration of sodium hypochlorite solution (6%).
challenge.impact: Resulted in a mixture with only ~40% Fe4+ content, limiting the purity and effectiveness of the synthesized material.

solution.description: Used iodometric redox titration to quantify Fe4+ content and proceeded with further characterization.
solution.effectiveness: Partially effective; the synthesized material still contained impurities and incomplete oxidation.

evidence.data: Iodometric redox titration results indicated ~40% Fe4+ in the obtained mixture.

context.material_properties: CaFeO3 is a perovskite oxide with Fe4+ ions critical for its electronic and catalytic properties.
context.experimental_conditions: Oxidation performed using 6% sodium hypochlorite solution.
context.application_relevance: Incomplete oxidation impacts the material's performance in applications requiring high-purity Fe4+ phases.

challenge.description: Severe oxidative delithiation during acid treatment, leading to structural changes and reduction in layer spacing.
challenge.impact: Adverse crystal structure changes and reduced interlayer spacing from 4.73 Å to 4.32 Å, affecting material stability and performance.

solution.description: Characterized the resultant NiO2 phase using XRD and magnetic susceptibility measurements.
solution.effectiveness: Effective in identifying the extent of structural changes but did not mitigate the degradation.

evidence.data: XRD patterns showed distorted layered lattice, and magnetic susceptibility measurements indicated disrupted interlayer magnetic interactions.

context.material_properties: LiNiO2 is a layered oxide with Jahn-Teller active Ni3+ ions, critical for its electrochemical properties.
context.application_relevance: Structural degradation impacts its use in lithium-ion batteries and other electrochemical systems.

challenge.description: Rapid dissolution and O2 evolution during acid treatment due to high redox potential of Ni4+ ions.
challenge.impact: Complete dissolution of the solid within minutes, preventing isolation of the material for further use.

solution.description: Confirmed O2 evolution using a home-built O2 detector and characterized dissolution behavior.
solution.methodology: Gas detection and dissolution analysis techniques.
solution.effectiveness: Effective in understanding the dissolution mechanism but did not prevent material loss.

evidence.data: O2 evolution confirmed by gas detector; rapid dissolution observed in acid treatment experiments.

context.material_properties: Sr1.286NiO3 contains Jahn-Teller active Ni3+ ions and exhibits high redox potential.
context.application_relevance: Material instability limits its use in electrochemical applications requiring solid-phase stability.
